trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> types to UI Automation.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer> is used as a peer for <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> when it contains the following tree:
![HwndSource->Visual->2 UIElement objects](~/add/media/apgenericroot.png "HwndSource->Visual->2 UIElement objects")

Because only <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types have peers, and visuals are not <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types, a common parent does not exist in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree for the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types.

[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] expects a single root peer from the application; therefore, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_avalonwinfx](~/includes/tlasharptla-avalonwinfx-md.md)] creates a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> in order to serve as a single root peer to parent peers for the two <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types.
Typically, the root peer is a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowAutomationPeer>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the control type for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType.Pane"></xref> enumeration value.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the bounding rectangle of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle"></xref>.
The bounding rectangle.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
A string that contains "Pane".
Gets the text label of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GenericRootAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName"></xref>.
You can think of the name property as if it were a string of text that users use to explain the control they are referring to.

Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
The string that contains the label.
